manual.ask_ai_prompt: Press 'Ask AI' to see its recommended move.

scenario_tester.title: AI Scenario Tester
scenario_tester.no_result: Run a test to see the AI's decision.
scenario_tester.regenerate_hands_tooltip: Load a predefined scenario to use this feature.

parda_y_gano.title: 'Parda y Gano' (Tie and Win) Opportunity
parda_y_gano.description: This classic scenario tests the AI's ability to recognize a guaranteed win. The first trick was a tie ('parda'). According to Truco rules, the winner of the second trick now wins the entire round. The AI is set up to be the first to play in this decisive second trick and is given a hand that can beat any possible remaining card the opponent might have. The test is to see if the AI correctly identifies this risk-free, high-value opportunity and escalates the bet by calling 'Truco' before playing its winning card.

do_or_die.title: Do-or-Die Truco Response
do_or_die.description: This is an endgame pressure test. The opponent is one point away from winning the game (14 points) and has called 'Truco'. If the AI folds ('No Quiero'), it concedes 1 point and loses the game. If the AI accepts ('Quiero') and loses the trick, it concedes 2 points and also loses the game. The AI is given a very weak hand. The correct strategic play is to always accept ('Quiero'), because folding is a guaranteed loss, whereas accepting provides a slim, non-zero chance of winning if the opponent made a mistake or is bluffing. This scenario tests the AI's endgame logic.

lopsided_bait.title: Lopsided Hand Envido Bait
lopsided_bait.description: This tests an advanced deceptive tactic. The AI is given a 'lopsided' hand: very high points for Envido (e.g., 31+) but very weak cards for Truco. The standard play would be to call Envido immediately. However, the advanced strategy is to 'bait' the opponent by playing a card silently. The goal is to make the opponent think the AI has a weak Envido, encouraging them to call it themselves. This allows the AI to then counter-escalate with 'Real Envido' or 'Falta Envido', maximizing its points in the only phase it can win, while avoiding a likely loss in the Truco phase. This tests the AI's strategic baiting logic.

envido_primero.title: 'Envido Primero' (Envido Goes First) Response
envido_primero.description: This scenario tests the AI's understanding of rule priorities. The opponent has called 'Truco' in the first trick. However, the opportunity to call Envido is still open. The AI is given an excellent hand for Envido (e.g., 33 points). The correct play is not to respond to the Truco call directly, but to interrupt the flow of the game by calling 'Envido Primero'. This forces the Envido bet to be resolved before the Truco bet continues. This tests the AI's rule knowledge and ability to prioritize point-scoring opportunities.

flor_vs_envido.title: Flor vs. Envido Response
flor_vs_envido.description: Another rule priority test. The opponent has called 'Envido'. The AI, however, has been dealt a 'Flor' (three cards of the same suit). According to the rules, Flor beats and nullifies any Envido bet. The AI should not respond to the Envido call (e.g., by accepting or escalating). Instead, it must declare its 'Flor', which automatically wins 3 points and cancels the Envido sequence. This tests the AI's knowledge of the absolute priority of Flor.

endgame_pressure_truco.title: Endgame Pressure: The 'Truco' to Win
endgame_pressure_truco.description: This scenario recreates a high-stakes endgame. The AI is at 14 points (one away from victory), and the opponent is close behind at 13. It is the AI's turn to act. A simple round win would give the AI the game. The test is to see how the AI behaves under this immense pressure. Will it play conservatively, or will it take a risk and call 'Truco' immediately, attempting to force the opponent to fold and secure an instant victory? This scenario demonstrates the AI's 'Game Pressure' system and its willingness to make calculated gambles to close out a match.

banter_low_glimpse.title: Feint with a Strong Hand
banter_low_glimpse.description: The AI has a very strong hand (e.g., Ace of Spades, a 5, a 4) and it's its turn to play during an already accepted 'Truco'. This scenario tests the AI's 'feint' tactic. Instead of playing its strongest card (the Ace) and potentially scaring the opponent away, the AI should opt to play its weakest card (the 4) as bait. The goal is to hide its true strength, encourage the opponent to escalate the bet to 'Retruco', and then win the round with its remaining high cards.

dual_brava_probe.title: Dual Brava Mid-Low Probe
dual_brava_probe.description: AI has two top bravas (1♠, 1♣) and a mid-low card (6♦). Fresh round at 0-0. Tests the AI's ability to bait by leading with the non-obvious 6♦ instead of revealing its strength, aiming to provoke a Truco call it can easily counter.

ancho_feint_chain.title: Ancho Feint Chain
ancho_feint_chain.description: AI has 1♠, 3♥, 5♣ after a known Envido. Tests leading with non-brava cards (3♥, 5♣) to feign weakness before using the 1♠.

false_ace_bait.title: False Ace Bait
false_ace_bait.description: AI has 1♣, 1♥, 2♦ during a Truco. Tests leading with the weak 1♥ to bait an escalation (Vale Cuatro), saving the strong 1♣.

tie_breaker_low.title: Tie-Breaker Low
tie_breaker_low.description: AI has 1♠, 7♥, 4♦ after a tie. Tests using the subtle 7♥ (false 7) as the decider instead of the powerful 1♠ to bait a raise.

signal_masked_depletion.title: Signal-Masked Depletion
signal_masked_depletion.description: AI has 1♣, 1♠, 10♠. Tests using a proxy signal and leading with the 10♠ to imply bravas are spent, baiting a Truco.

post_envido_low_shift.title: Post-Envido Low Shift
post_envido_low_shift.description: AI has 1♠, 7♦, 12♥. After Envido, tests leading with the unrelated 12♥ to hide the bravas and bait a Retruco.

triple_brava_figure_probe.title: Triple Brava Figure Probe
triple_brava_figure_probe.description: AI has two top bravas + a figure. Tests leading with the figure to probe, not the bravas, to conserve power.

parda_ancho_hint.title: Parda Ancho Hint
parda_ancho_hint.description: AI has 1♣, 3♦, 6♠ after a tie. Tests leading with the 3♦ to hint at a stronger hand without revealing the 1♣, baiting a Vale Cuatro.

false_7_deplete.title: False 7 Deplete
false_7_deplete.description: Tests the AI's decision when facing a 'Retruco' with a deceptive hand: one very strong card (A♠), a probing card (the false 7♣), and a low card (5♦). The test is to see if the AI, recognizing the strength of the Ace of Spades, is confident enough to accept or even escalate to 'Vale Cuatro', despite holding two low-value cards.

envido_suit_misdirect.title: Envido Suit Misdirect
envido_suit_misdirect.description: AI has 1♣, 2♠, 4♥ after showing a spade Envido. Tests leading with the unrelated 4♥ to misdirect from the suit containing the 1♣.

brava_kiss_signal.title: Brava Kiss Signal
brava_kiss_signal.description: AI has 1♠, 1♦, 2♣. Tests leading with the weak 1♦ to bait an Envido-Truco chain.

mid_game_figure_low.title: Mid-Game Figure Low
mid_game_figure_low.description: AI has 7♠, 12♦, 10♥ after winning trick 1. Tests leading with a figure (12♦) to feign weakness and bait a Retruco.

late_false_ace_chain.title: Late False Ace Chain
late_false_ace_chain.description: AI has 1♣, 1♠, 1♥ in a high-stakes endgame. Tests leading with the weak 1♥ to bait a call, saving the 1♠ for the clinch.

parda_false_7.title: Parda False 7
parda_false_7.description: AI has 7♦, 7♣, 3♠ after a tie. Tests leading with the deceptive 7♣ (false 7) to bait a raise.

ancho_deplete_post_tie.title: Ancho Deplete Post-Tie
ancho_deplete_post_tie.description: AI has 1♣, 3♠, 11♦ after two ties. Tests leading with 3♠ to hint at strength and bait a call to avoid a mano-decided loss.

dual_false_bait.title: Dual False Bait
dual_false_bait.description: AI has 1♠, 1♦, 1♥ in the endgame. Tests leading with a false ace to bait a call.

mid_low_signal_mask.title: Mid-Low Signal Mask
mid_low_signal_mask.description: AI has 7♠, 6♣, 2♥. Tests leading with 6♣ to probe, masking real strength.

figure_ancho_shift.title: Figure Ancho Shift
figure_ancho_shift.description: AI has 1♣, 3♦, 10♠ after winning trick 1. Tests leading with 10♠ to feign depletion, setting up a bait with the remaining cards.

endgame_low_balance.title: Endgame Low Balance
endgame_low_balance.description: AI has 1♠, 5♦, 7♣ at 14-14. Tests leading with a balanced mid-low card (5♦) to avoid showing desperation and bait a Vale Cuatro.

probe_false_deplete.title: Probe False Deplete
probe_false_deplete.description: AI has 1♣, 12♠, 4♥ during Retruco. Tests playing the 12♠ to probe, then the low 4♥ to feign weakness.

tie_ancho_glimpse.title: Tie Ancho Glimpse
tie_ancho_glimpse.description: AI has 7♦, 3♣, 6♠ after a tie. Tests leading with 6♠ to bait a raise in the decider.

brava_mid_chain.title: Brava Mid Chain
brava_mid_chain.description: AI has 1♠, 7♠, 2♦ after a low Envido. Tests leading with the very low 2♦ to feign weakness, chaining to 7♠ on a bait.

signal_false_low.title: Signal False Low
signal_false_low.description: AI has 1♣, 5♥, 11♠. Tests leading with 5♥ to mask its real strength.

post_parda_figure.title: Post-Parda Figure
post_parda_figure.description: AI has 1♠, 10♦, 7♥ after a tie. Tests leading with 10♦ to feign depletion and bait a Truco resume.

dual_ancho_bait.title: Dual Ancho Bait
dual_ancho_bait.description: AI has 1♣, 3♠, 3♥. Tests leading with a 3 to hint at strength without revealing the brava, baiting an early Truco.

false_brava_probe.title: False Brava Probe
false_brava_probe.description: AI has 7♠, 7♣, 4♠ during Truco. Tests playing the false 7♣ to probe before committing.

envido_low_unrelated.title: Envido Low Unrelated
envido_low_unrelated.description: AI has 1♠, 6♣, 2♦ after a club Envido. Tests leading with the unrelated 2♦ to misdirect.

all_tie_mid_hint.title: All-Tie Mid Hint
all_tie_mid_hint.description: AI has 1♣, 5♠, 12♥ after two ties. Tests leading with 5♠ to hint at strength and avoid a mano loss.

clutch_false_deplete.title: Clutch False Deplete
clutch_false_deplete.description: AI has 1♠, 7♦, 10♣ during Vale Cuatro. Tests leading with 7♦ to feign depletion, saving the 1♠ for the final trick.

explanations.accept_truco_do_or_die: The AI accepts because folding guarantees losing the game. Accepting is the only choice that offers a chance to win, however slim.
explanations.decline_truco_weak: The AI folds because its calculated odds of winning are extremely low. It chooses to cut its losses rather than risk more points.
explanations.decline_truco_low_equity: The AI folds because its calculated odds of winning are extremely low. It chooses to cut its losses rather than risk more points.
explanations.decline_truco_certain_loss: The AI folds because its calculated odds of winning are extremely low. It chooses to cut its losses rather than risk more points.
explanations.accept_truco_solid: The AI accepts the Truco call because its hand is strong enough to compete. The calculated equity is positive or close to neutral.
explanations.accept_truco_decent_equity: The AI accepts the Truco call because its hand is strong enough to compete. The calculated equity is positive or close to neutral.
explanations.accept_truco_bluff_call: The AI's hand is weak, but it accepts the Truco call on the suspicion that the opponent is bluffing, based on game pressure or opponent modeling.
explanations.escalate_truco_high_equity: The AI escalates the bet because it has a very strong hand and its calculated win probability is high. This is a value bet.
explanations.escalate_truco_strong: The AI escalates the bet because it has a very strong hand and its calculated win probability is high. This is a value bet.
explanations.escalate_truco_elite: The AI escalates the bet because it has a very strong hand and its calculated win probability is high. This is a value bet.
explanations.escalate_truco_bluff: The AI escalates the bet as a bluff. Its hand is weak, but it's trying to pressure the opponent into folding.
explanations.escalate_truco_weak_bluff: The AI escalates the bet as a bluff. Its hand is weak, but it's trying to pressure the opponent into folding.
explanations.escalate_truco_desperation_bluff: The AI escalates the bet as a bluff. Its hand is weak, but it's trying to pressure the opponent into folding.
explanations.call_truco_bluff: The AI initiates the Truco call as a bluff. It has a weak hand but is leveraging game pressure or the opponent's tendency to fold.
explanations.call_truco_value: The AI initiates the Truco call for value. Its hand strength exceeds its internal threshold for making a confident bet.
explanations.call_truco_won_trick1: The AI calls Truco because it won the first trick and has a strong enough hand to likely win one of the remaining two tricks.
explanations.call_truco_certain_win: The AI calls Truco because it has identified a guaranteed win condition for the round (e.g., holding an unbeatable card).
explanations.call_truco_parda_y_gano: The AI calls Truco because it has identified a guaranteed win condition for the round (e.g., holding an unbeatable card).
explanations.call_truco_post_parda_bluff: The AI calls Truco as a bluff after the first trick was a tie. This is a strategic move to capitalize on the opponent's uncertainty.
explanations.call_envido_strong: The AI calls Envido for value because its Envido points are high and exceed its internal threshold, adjusted for game pressure.
explanations.call_real_dominant: The AI calls Envido for value because its Envido points are high and exceed its internal threshold, adjusted for game pressure.
explanations.call_envido_bluff: The AI calls Envido as a bluff. Its points are low, but it's taking a calculated risk based on the opponent's fold rate and game pressure.
explanations.call_envido_marginal: The AI calls Envido with a marginal hand. It's not a strong bet, but there's a small chance of winning or gathering information.
explanations.call_falta_win_game: The AI calls Falta Envido, the highest Envido bet. This is either an aggressive move to win the game with a dominant hand or a defensive move to prevent the opponent from winning.
explanations.call_falta_defensive: The AI calls Falta Envido, the highest Envido bet. This is either an aggressive move to win the game with a dominant hand or a defensive move to prevent the opponent from winning.
explanations.decline_envido_weak: The AI declines the Envido call because its calculated advantage is negative. It believes the opponent's hand is stronger.
explanations.accept_envido_good_odds: The AI accepts the Envido call because its calculated advantage is positive. It believes its hand has a good chance of winning.
explanations.accept_envido_hero_call: The AI accepts the Envido call despite having a weak hand. This is a 'hero call' made on the chance the opponent is bluffing.
explanations.escalate_real_stronger: The AI escalates the Envido bet because it calculates a significant advantage over the opponent's likely hand.
explanations.escalate_envido_strong: The AI escalates the Envido bet because it calculates a significant advantage over the opponent's likely hand.
explanations.call_flor_strong: The AI calls Flor because it has three cards of the same suit. This is a mandatory and high-value call.
explanations.ack_flor_weak: The AI acknowledges the opponent's Flor call. It either doesn't have Flor or has one with a lower value, conceding the points.
explanations.ack_flor_no_flor: The AI acknowledges the opponent's Flor call. It either doesn't have Flor or has one with a lower value, conceding the points.
explanations.call_contraflor_strong: The AI escalates to Contraflor because it also has Flor and believes its point value is very high and likely to win.
explanations.accept_contraflor_strong: The AI accepts the Contraflor challenge because its Flor value is high enough to meet its risk threshold.
explanations.decline_contraflor_weak: The AI declines the Contraflor challenge because its Flor value is too low to risk the high-stakes bet.
explanations.see_opponent: The AI plays a low or non-critical card to probe the opponent's hand without revealing its own strength.
explanations.secure_hand: The AI plays its strongest available card to secure a trick win, especially when it has the advantage (e.g., is 'mano' or won the previous trick).
explanations.win_round_cheap: The AI plays the weakest card that is still strong enough to win the trick, conserving its more powerful cards for later.
explanations.discard_low: The AI plays its weakest card because it cannot win the current trick. This is a move to cut losses and save better cards.
explanations.parda_y_canto: The AI intentionally plays a card that ties the trick ('parda') while holding a winning card in reserve. This is a setup to call Truco in the next trick with a high chance of success.
explanations.unknown_action: The AI's action doesn't fit a standard strategic category. This may occur in complex or unusual game states.
explanations.accept_truco_lookahead_fold: The AI accepts Truco instead of escalating because its lookahead simulation predicted it would fold to a subsequent Vale Cuatro.
explanations.escalate_truco_dominant_card: The AI escalates Truco because it holds a dominant final card and infers the opponent cannot beat it.
explanations.accept_truco_mixed: The AI makes a randomized decision based on its mixed-strategy module to remain unpredictable in borderline situations.
explanations.decline_truco_mixed: The AI makes a randomized decision based on its mixed-strategy module to remain unpredictable in borderline situations.
explanations.escalate_truco_mixed_bluff: The AI makes a randomized decision based on its mixed-strategy module to remain unpredictable in borderline situations.

batchAnalyzer.title: Batch Hand Analyzer
batchAnalyzer.description: This tool runs the AI's strength assessment algorithm over {{count}} strategically distinct hand combinations to evaluate its perception of value. This helps in calibrating the AI's betting thresholds and identifying potential biases.
